revised_title: A New Natural Order of Plants: Julianiaceae
tldr: The author describes the Julianiaceae, a new natural order of plants, consisting of two genera and five species. The plants are resiuiferous, tortuously branched, deciduous, dioecious shrubs or small trees with unique ovule structures and samaroid fruits. The author discusses the history, geographical distribution, and potential relationships of this new order to other plant families.
